page.title: 18WEATHER
page.content: THE WEATHER IN OUR BLOCK IS GENERALLY MILD BECAUSE WE ARE IN THE SOUTHERN PART OF ENGLAND. HOWEVER, BECAUSE WE ARE FAIRLY HIGH (THE HIGHEST PART OF OUR BLOCK IS 120M ABOVE SEA LEVEL) AND THERE IS NO NATURAL PROTECTION FROM THE PREVAILING SOUTH WESTERLY WINDS, WE DO SOMETIMES HAVE SNOW AND THEN WE CAN BE CUT OFF AS WE WERE THIS YEAR FOR A WHILE. THIS HAPPENS BECAUSE THE LOCAL COUNCIL CAN'T CLEAR OUR SMALL COUNTRY ROADS. OUR RAINFALL IS THE SAME AS THE AVERAGE RAINFALL FOR SOUTHERN ENGLAND AND OUR SUNSHINE LEVELS ARE ALSO THOSE OF A TYPICAL SOUTHERN AREA AWAY FROM THE COAST. THIS SUMMER THE WEATHER HAS BEEN VERY WET, LIKE OTHER PLACES IN ENGLAND AND AS A RESULT THE FARMERS HAVE HAD DIFFICULTY IN HARVESTING.
